verses.roman:
caudda mādala bāje ucca saṅkīrtana
eka eka nartakera preme bhāsila bhuvana

synonyms: caudda mādala—fourteen mṛdaṅgas; bāje—were being played; ucca saṅkīrtana—loud congregational chanting; eka eka—of each group; nartakera—of the dancer; preme—in ecstatic love; bhāsila bhuvana—inundated the entire world.
translation: Fourteen mṛdaṅgas resounded with the loud congregational chanting, and in each group was a dancer whose dance of ecstatic love inundated the entire world.
